body_html:
This is how Python serialization works, not a PyTorch issue.

Since you saved a custom object, when it loads it, it needs to use the class definition to reconstruct the object, which will cause issue if it can't find the class definition.

I'm replying in English since this is an English GitHub and people can refer to this in future.
body_text:
This is how Python serialization works, not a PyTorch issue.
Since you saved a custom object, when it loads it, it needs to use the class definition to reconstruct the object, which will cause issue if it can't find the class definition.
I'm replying in English since this is an English GitHub and people can refer to this in future.
body:
This is how Python serialization works, not a PyTorch issue. 

Since you saved a custom object, when it loads it, it needs to use the class definition to reconstruct the object, which will cause issue if it can't find the class definition.

I'm replying in English since this is an English GitHub and people can refer to this in future.
